summary: This document is a chain of emails between FBI personnel from September 23-24, 2019, coordinating victim briefings for the Epstein case in New York and Miami. It discusses consolidating victim lists from different FBI field offices, tracking invitation responses, and drafting invitation letters for victims to attend informational meetings.

persons.name: Osborn
persons.context: ASAC Osborn requested weekly oversight of victim briefing invitations and confirmed the briefings would proceed. Mentioned as providing guidance and approval.

persons.name: Sosa
persons.context: VS Sosa previously reserved a conference room in Miami for the Epstein victim briefing.

persons.name: Flood, H.
persons.context: Recipient of an email in the chain regarding the Epstein briefings confirmation.

connections.description: Osborn will inform Miami EM that the conference room reserved by Sosa is for the Epstein briefing, indicating a supervisory or coordinating relationship.

events.title: Epstein Victim Briefing - Florida
events.description: A victim briefing meeting scheduled in Miramar, FL, for victims to learn about available services from the FBI Victim Services Division, SDNY, and FBI NY.

events.title: Epstein Victim Briefing - New York
events.description: A victim briefing meeting scheduled in New York, NY, for victims to learn about available services from the FBI Victim Services Division, SDNY, and FBI NY.

events.title: Coordination of Victim Lists
events.description: FBI personnel discuss consolidating victim lists from the New York (39 victims) and MM (35 victims) cases into a single tracking spreadsheet for the briefings.

keyFacts: The FBI confirmed victim briefings for the Epstein case in both Miami and New York in September 2019.
The New York FBI case (3IE-NY-3027571) involved 39 victims, while a separate MM case (31E-MM-108062) involved 35 victims, indicating a multi-jurisdictional victim pool.
Invitation letters were drafted for victims to attend briefings on October 15, 2019, in Florida and October 23, 2019, in New York, with a response deadline of October 4, 2019.
FBI personnel coordinated to track victim invitations, responses, and logistical details like flights and hotels for victim attendance.
The email chain shows systematic post-arrest victim outreach and service coordination by the FBI and SDNY following Epstein's arrest.
